definitions: climbing shrub with fragrant white or yellow star-shaped flowers
aromatic oil extracted from jasmine flowers used in perfumes
dried jasmine flowers used to scent tea leaves
examples: The jasmine vine covered the garden wall with blooms
Night-blooming jasmine filled the evening air with fragrance
She dabbed jasmine oil behind her ears as perfume
The massage therapist used jasmine essential oil for relaxation
Green tea infused with jasmine makes a delicate beverage
Jasmine tea is traditionally served at Chinese restaurants

definitions: opaque variety of quartz with red, yellow, or brown coloring
polished jasper used in jewelry and ornamental objects
examples: The geologist identified jasper formations in the rock outcrop
Red jasper contains iron oxide that gives its distinctive color
Her necklace featured polished jasper beads in earth tones
Ancient civilizations carved jasper into seals and amulets

definitions: yellowing of skin and eyes caused by excess bilirubin in blood
biased or cynical attitude that distorts judgment of situations or people
examples: The patient developed jaundice due to liver dysfunction
Newborn jaundice usually resolves without treatment within weeks
Years of disappointment left him with jaundice toward politics
She viewed the proposal with jaundice after previous failures

definitions: informal term for coffee, especially strong black coffee
large island in Indonesia with capital Jakarta
object-oriented programming language developed by Sun Microsystems
examples: He needed his morning java before starting work
The diner served strong java twenty-four hours daily
Java produces much of Indonesia's rice and tea
Volcanic soil makes Java ideal for agricultural cultivation
Web applications often use Java for backend development
She learned Java programming in her computer science course

definitions: light spear designed for throwing in athletic competition
field event where athletes throw javelin for maximum distance
examples: The javelin measured exactly eight feet in length
Ancient warriors used javelins for hunting and combat
She won gold medal in javelin at the Olympics
His javelin throw exceeded seventy meters in competition

definitions: either of two bones forming the framework of the mouth
mechanical parts that grip or hold objects in tools or machines
examples: The dentist examined her lower jaw for signs of TMJ
He clenched his jaw in frustration during the meeting
The vise jaws held the wood piece firmly in place
Pliers have serrated jaws for better gripping power

definitions: the bone of the lower jaw that forms the chin and holds teeth
examples: The fossil jawbone revealed the creature's dietary habits
A broken jawbone requires careful surgical repair procedures
Archaeologists discovered an ancient human jawbone at the site
The horse's jawbone showed signs of dental disease

definitions: medium-sized bird of crow family with bright blue or colored plumage
examples: The blue jay chased squirrels away from the feeder
Steller's jays are common in western mountain forests
A jay's harsh call warned other birds of danger
Jays cache thousands of acorns for winter food

definitions: American music style characterized by improvisation, syncopation, and complex rhythms
informal term for enthusiasm, excitement, or meaningless talk
examples: New Orleans jazz developed from blues and ragtime traditions
The jazz quartet performed standards at the nightclub
Don't give me that jazz about being too busy
The presentation needed more jazz to engage the audience

definitions: feeling of resentment or insecurity over another's advantages, possessions, or relationships
examples: Jealousy poisoned their friendship when she got promoted
His jealousy erupted when she talked to other men
Professional jealousy prevented collaboration between the researchers
Sibling jealousy often emerges after a new baby arrives

definitions: durable cotton fabric with diagonal ribbing, typically used for casual clothing
examples: Blue jean material becomes softer with repeated washing
The jacket was made from heavyweight jean fabric
Designer jean brands command premium prices in stores
She preferred jean skirts over traditional denim pants

definitions: small, sturdy motor vehicle with four-wheel drive originally for military use
brand of sport utility vehicles known for off-road capability
examples: Military jeeps transported troops across rough terrain
The army surplus jeep still ran after forty years
Their Jeep Cherokee handled mountain roads with ease
She drove her Jeep through muddy trails without difficulty

definitions: sweetened, flavored gelatin that sets into a semi-solid wobbling dessert
examples: The children loved lime jello with whipped cream topping
Hospital meals often include jello as a dessert option
She made layered jello salad for the potluck dinner
Sugar-free jello contains fewer calories than regular varieties

definitions: clear fruit spread made from strained fruit juice and sugar
any soft, semi-transparent substance with gel-like consistency
examples: Grape jelly paired perfectly with peanut butter sandwiches
She made strawberry jelly from garden-fresh berries
The jellyfish left stinging jelly on the swimmer's skin
Petroleum jelly protects skin from moisture loss effectively

definitions: free-swimming marine animal with gelatinous umbrella-shaped bell and trailing tentacles
examples: Box jellyfish possess venom deadly to human beings
Jellyfish blooms can clog fishing nets and power plants
The aquarium's jellyfish exhibit featured bioluminescent species
Moon jellyfish drift with ocean currents seeking plankton

definitions: state of being exposed to possible loss, harm, or failure
legal principle preventing repeated prosecution for same offense
examples: The storm put coastal residents in serious jeopardy
His reckless spending placed the company in financial jeopardy
Double jeopardy protects defendants from multiple trials
The mistrial raised questions about jeopardy attachment timing

definitions: quick, sharp, sudden movement or pull
informal term for an obnoxious or contemptible person
meat preserved by drying, especially in Caribbean cuisine
examples: The train started with a sudden jerk forward
He felt a jerk on his fishing line signaling a bite
That jerk cut in line without apologizing
Don't be such a jerk to your younger sister
Jamaican jerk chicken features spicy seasoning blend
They made beef jerk for the camping trip

definitions: lean meat that has been trimmed, cut into strips, and dried
examples: Beef jerky provides portable protein for hiking trips
The convenience store sold various flavors of turkey jerky
Homemade venison jerky requires careful temperature control
Teriyaki jerky combines sweet and savory flavor profiles

definitions: soft, stretchy knitted fabric often used for clothing
shirt worn by athletes displaying team colors and numbers
breed of small dairy cattle originally from Jersey island
examples: Cotton jersey fabric drapes well for casual clothing
The dress was made from lightweight jersey material
His football jersey bore the number twelve proudly
Fans wore team jerseys to show their support
Jersey cows produce milk with high butterfat content
The dairy farm raised purebred Jersey cattle

definitions: something said or done for amusement rather than seriously
examples: His comment about quitting was made in jest
She couldn't tell if he spoke in jest or earnest
The jest fell flat when nobody laughed at it
Medieval court jesters entertained with jests and tricks

definitions: historical entertainer employed by nobility to provide amusement through humor and tricks
examples: The king's jester wore colorful clothes with bells
Medieval jesters often delivered political commentary through humor
Court jesters balanced entertainment with subtle wisdom
The jester's pointed hat became an iconic costume element

definitions: aircraft powered by jet engines for high-speed flight
forceful stream of liquid or gas ejected from nozzle
hard black fossilized wood used as gemstone
examples: The commercial jet carried three hundred passengers
Fighter jets broke the sound barrier during training
Water jets cleaned the concrete with high pressure
The fountain's jets created dancing water patterns
Victorian mourning jewelry often featured polished jet
Whitby jet comes from fossilized monkey puzzle trees

definitions: structure projecting into water to protect harbors or influence currents
examples: Fishing enthusiasts gathered on the jetty at dawn
Stone jetties protected the harbor from strong waves
The wooden jetty extended two hundred feet into the bay
Boats moored alongside the jetty for loading supplies

definitions: precious stone cut and polished for use in jewelry
person or thing that is treasured or highly valued
examples: The crown contained jewels worth millions of dollars
She inherited her grandmother's jewel collection
Their daughter was the jewel of the family
This restaurant is the jewel of downtown dining

definitions: person who makes, sells, or repairs jewelry and watches
examples: The jeweler resized her engagement ring perfectly
An experienced jeweler can identify genuine stones quickly
Local jewelers often provide personalized service
The jeweler's loupe magnified tiny diamond flaws

definitions: British spelling of person who makes, sells, or repairs jewelry
examples: The jeweller crafted bespoke pieces for wealthy clients
A master jeweller requires years of training
The high street jeweller offered watch repair services
Royal jewellers hold prestigious appointments from the crown

definitions: British spelling for decorative items worn for personal adornment
examples: Her jewellery box contained family heirlooms
The museum displayed ancient Egyptian jewellery
Costume jewellery offers affordable fashion options
The insurance covered stolen jewellery up to ten thousand pounds

definitions: decorative items worn for personal adornment made from precious materials
examples: She kept valuable jewelry in a bank safety deposit box
The jewelry store specialized in custom engagement rings
Vintage jewelry has become increasingly popular with collectors
His jewelry collection included rare antique pieces

definitions: triangular sail set forward of the main mast on sailing vessel
examples: The sailor adjusted the jib for better wind capture
A torn jib forced them to reduce sailing speed
Racing yachts use multiple jibs for different conditions
The jib sheet controls the angle of the sail

definitions: quick lively dance with leaping movements traditionally from British Isles
device used to guide tools or hold work in manufacturing
examples: Irish dancers performed traditional jigs at the festival
The fiddle player struck up a lively jig
The carpenter used a dovetail jig for precise joints
A drilling jig ensures holes align perfectly

definitions: power saw with narrow blade for cutting irregular curves
puzzle consisting of interlocking pieces forming a picture
examples: The jigsaw cut intricate patterns in the plywood
A variable-speed jigsaw handles different material thicknesses
The thousand-piece jigsaw took weeks to complete
Children develop spatial skills working jigsaw puzzles

definitions: Islamic concept of struggle against enemies of Islam or spiritual struggle
personal struggle or crusade for a principle or belief
examples: Scholars debate whether jihad means inner spiritual struggle
Some groups misinterpret jihad to justify violence
She declared a personal jihad against corporate corruption
His jihad for environmental protection consumed his life

definitions: short crowbar used by burglars to force open windows or doors
examples: The burglar used a jimmy to break into the house
Police found jimmy marks on the window frame
He kept a jimmy in his toolbox for emergencies
The jimmy bent when he tried forcing the lock

definitions: light ringing sound made by small metal objects
short catchy song used in advertising to promote products
examples: Coins made a jingle in his pocket as he walked
The jingle of sleigh bells announced Santa's arrival
The toothpaste jingle stuck in her head all day
Advertising jingles help brand recognition and recall

definitions: person or thing that brings bad luck or misfortune
examples: Some athletes believe mentioning victory creates a jinx
She felt like a jinx after three relationships failed
The team blamed their losing streak on a jinx
Breaking mirrors supposedly brings a seven-year jinx

definitions: feeling of nervousness or unease about something
unwanted variation in electronic signal timing or image stability
examples: Pre-performance jitters affected even experienced actors
Coffee gave him the jitters before the interview
Network jitter causes poor video call quality
The oscilloscope measured jitter in the signal

definitions: lively dance popular in 1940s performed to swing music
misleading, meaningless, or dishonest talk
examples: Couples danced the jive at the vintage ballroom
The jive competition featured athletic dance moves
Don't give me that jive about working late
His explanation sounded like jive to experienced detectives

definitions: regular paid position of employment
piece of work or task to be done
criminal enterprise such as robbery
examples: She found a job in marketing after graduation
The economic downturn eliminated thousands of jobs
Painting the house was a bigger job than expected
The repair job took three hours to complete
The gang planned a bank job for Friday night
Police suspected an inside job at the museum

definitions: middleman who buys from manufacturers and sells to retailers
person who does piecework or small jobs
examples: The jobber supplied multiple retail stores with inventory
Stock jobbers facilitate trades on the exchange floor
Freelance jobbers handled overflow work for the company
The jobber completed various maintenance tasks around campus

definitions: informal term for athlete, especially in school or college
protective undergarment worn during sports activities
examples: The high school jock excelled in three varsity sports
Jocks dominated the school's social hierarchy
Athletes wear jocks to prevent sports injuries
The sporting goods store sold jocks in various sizes

definitions: professional rider in horse races
person who maneuvers for advantage or position
examples: The jockey guided his mount to victory
Professional jockeys maintain strict weight limits
Politicians jockey for position before elections
Drivers jockey for lanes in heavy traffic

definitions: steady slow run for exercise
slight shake or push to activate or remind
examples: His morning jog covered three miles through the park
A daily jog helps maintain cardiovascular health
The photo might jog your memory about that day
Give the machine a jog if it gets stuck

definitions: activity of running at steady gentle pace for fitness
examples: Jogging burns approximately one hundred calories per mile
She took up jogging to improve her health
Morning jogging helps clear the mind before work
The park's jogging trail circles the lake twice

definitions: informal term for toilet or bathroom
man who pays for sexual services
examples: He excused himself to use the john

The john left quickly after the transaction

definitions: place or line where two or more things are connected
examples: The join between pipes must be watertight

A visible join showed where panels met
The join in the fabric was barely noticeable

definitions: skilled worker who constructs wooden components of buildings
examples: The joiner crafted custom cabinets for the kitchen

The joiner's workshop contained specialized woodworking tools

definitions: art and trade of constructing wooden joints and fittings
examples: Fine joinery requires precision and patience

definitions: process or action of linking or connecting things together
examples: The joining of the two companies created a powerhouse

Careful joining of fabric pieces ensures strong seams

definitions: point where bones connect allowing movement
place where people gather, especially for entertainment
marijuana cigarette
shared by or involving two or more parties
examples: Arthritis causes inflammation in finger joints
The knee joint bears significant body weight
The jazz joint featured live music nightly
They met at their favorite burger joint downtown
Police found a joint in his jacket pocket
Smoking joints remains illegal in many states

They opened a joint bank account after marriage

definitions: something said or done to provoke laughter
person or thing that is ridiculously inadequate
examples: His joke about the chicken made everyone laugh
She collected joke books to improve her comedy routine
The security system was a joke anyone could bypass
Their customer service is a complete joke
